item.title: Report X-2024020325
item.description:
Report X-2024020325

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET BOX DISCOVERED DURING PRELOAD SORT. DURING INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT BOTTLES LEAKED. PACKAGE PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED AT HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024020609
item.description:
Report X-2024020609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found on the 500/600 Belt leaking. It was put into a red tote and hauled off to the HazMat Cage for processing. DescribePack: The cap came loose from two plastic jugs. Seals under caps off. The box was soaked on the upper side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A red tote and HazMat bag were used to contain the spill. It was moved to the HazMat Cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020338
item.description:
Report X-2024020338

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The plastic bottle of Kester 186-18 soldering flux leaked from a loose cap. About 20 ounces were released. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival, the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

DescribePack: One of the jugs in the box leaked a small amount of contents from under the cap, even though the cap was on tight. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020415
item.description:
Report X-2024020415

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-20
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was given by sort manager. Notice discoloration on pkg. proceeded to open up pkg, discovered 1 gallon of isopropanol alcohol was half empty. when discovered, we placed pkg in hazmat cage and started hazmat processing. DescribePack: fiberboard box was still intact. 1 gallon of isopropanol was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: we placed half empty gallon in a plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2024020438
item.description:
Report X-2024020438

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was brought back to the QA cage by the driver after noticing that the pkg. was wet and had a strong odor. DescribePack: After inspecting the contents, it was noted that one of the 5 liter containers had the seal under the cap pushed in. Pkg. had orientation arrows on it. Plastic containers were placed inside a second box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in the HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024020273
item.description:
Report X-2024020273

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Oxidizer & Corrosive hazmat package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found a box contain 2 bottles of Rapicide PA part A 5-liters wet. 1 bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020461
item.description:
Report X-2024020461

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipping box was discovered wet, ripped and torn and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The package was being held at the station because it was missing the hazardous materials certification document. The box got ripped and torn causing all the plastic bottles of Sunnyside Muriatic Acid to come out and leak from loose caps. Caps were not secured. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of the wet package, it was place in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020433
item.description:
Report X-2024020433

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: WEST PALM BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer at 7:53 AM and was sent up the belt with high volume. Hazmat was spotted by ops manger and was sent down to VAU. it is unclear if damage was caused by being sent on the belt with high volume of packages or if the damage occurred when the hazmat was sent down VAU chute. DescribePack: Package is cracked along the bottom of cylinder drum causing minor leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed upright in hazmat bin and placed in hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2024020445
item.description:
Report X-2024020445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020445 SequenceEvent: At 14:37 driver noticed a foam substance on the floor of his truck. He found 3 hazmat packages. Caps came off some of the bottles causing the corrosive liquid to spill out. Driver informed us of the spill once he returned to station. The emergency phone number and Diversitech was called. Both stated that the hazmat could be cleaned up in house. Once the hazmats were processed as damaged the truck was cleaned. DescribePack: Caps on the top of the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Boxes, hazmats and all cleaning supplies were placed in hazmat bags and salvage drums. 2. X-2024020449 SequenceEvent: Driver noticed foam on floor at 14:27. He found that caps were off and loose of hazmats. He returned to station and notified us. Emergency and Diversitech were called and both stated in house clean up was ok. Once damage process was done boxes, hazmats and all cleaning supplies were placed hazmat bag and salvage drum. DescribePack: Caps on top of bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Boxes, hazmats and all cleaning supplies were placed in hazmat bag and salvage drum. 3. X-2024020450 SequenceEvent: Driver noticed foam on floor of truck at 14:37,he found caps off and loose of the hazmat bottles. He returned to station and notified us. We called Emergency and Diversitech both stated in house clean up was ok. Damage process was done and truck was cleaned up. DescribePack: Caps on top of bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box, hazmat and all cleaning supplies were placed in hazmat bag and salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024020267
item.description:
Report X-2024020267

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received off trailer damaged; wet. Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting contents, noticed that both caps were loose causing liquid to leak out. This is a comment issue with this shipper, their pkgs. never have protective material inside and when flaps are closed and taped, the caps are right under the flaps. Plastic bottles were probably missing about 4-5 oz. of liquid. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a 10 gal. container and placed in the HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

  • Description: After screening by TSA customer's checked bag erupted with flames after being placed in bag cart in bag room. Fire severely damaged customefs bag and also damaged two other customer's bags. Bag was moved and fire extinguished. Source of fire was a Performance Tool torch that had been packed in the customefs bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The plastic bucket was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The outer plastic bucket looks like it was crushed, ripping open the side of the bucket and spilling out some of the tabs inside. One of the tabs was ripped, and nine more were missing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket and tabs were collected and put into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020463
item.description:
Report X-2024020463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received off trailer 818689 out of 308-SANC, damaged. Pkg. taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting contents, it was noted that a 1 gallon can had an open lid, causing paint to leak out, around 12 oz. There were 2, 1 gallon cans and 4. 2 quart cans in pkg. The pkg. had orientation arrows on it, the gallon cans were placed in plastic bags with no clips, just the plastic ring that keeps the lid from opening. There were Styrofoam peanuts inside to cover the 4 small cans. The DPR states 16 damages, it was only 1, fat fingered. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

Report X-2024020385

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was going up the conveyer belt on 1300 around 6:30 a.m. when a PH noticed that it was leaking. PH removed the package to a safe area where it would not leak and away from everyone. Once QA got to the facility at 6:45 a.m., the manager let QA know about the package. DescribePack: Cap broke on the jerrican container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package from the vanlines and into a safe area.
